summary: Results-driven IT director with over 30 years of experience in diverse industries, including Port and Higher Education. Expertise includes team leadership, technical architecture, training and development, disaster recovery planning, and information protection analysis. Dynamic, resourceful, and extremely driven individual with a deep passion for creating and delivering programs and solutions that empower a team, company, and customer to meet and exceed desired expectations.
skills: LDCCA Certified Installer for Fiber Optic and Category 5/5E
Certified Construction Quality Management for Contractors by U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Hacker Techniques, Exploits and Incident Handling Training

experience.title: Director, Information Technology
experience.company: Board of Commissioners of the Port of New Orleans
experience.description: Manages the information technology center for the Port of New Orleans Board, develops and implements procedures to improve systems and operations, oversees vendor selection and contract negotiations, budgets for IT, leads strategic planning, ensures security and compliance, supervises IT and telecommunications staff, coordinates with internal departments and external agencies, and provides consulting on information systems and data processing.

experience.title: Associate Vice-President for Information Technology and Telecommunication
experience.description: Oversight for a staff of 22, created and managed the Office of Information Technology, developed and implemented the Strategic Plan, secured a $1.2 million grant to install fiber optic infrastructure, integrated IT and Telecommunication into a single department, provided university-wide data and communication services, expanded telecommunications units from 324 to over 2,000 and increased computer labs from two to nine.

education.school: Marine Sciences Research Center, School of Marine and Atmospheric Sciences

certifications: LDCCA Certified Installer for Fiber Optic and Category 5/5E
Certified Construction Quality Management for Contractors by U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Hacker Techniques, Exploits and Incident Handling Training
National Consortium of Educational Access Fellowship
